Package ohos.bundle

Class ApplicationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.bundle.ApplicationInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class ApplicationInfo
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Obtains configuration information about an application.
    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName​()
        Obtains the name of the application.

        You can use the reverse domain name notation to name an application. The prefix of the reverse domain name must be the same as the value of the package tag. You can also use a name starting with a period (.). The IDE will combine this name with the name defined in the package tag to form a complete application name. The name tag must be specified. You must have configured this tag in the configuration file.

        Returns:
        Returns the name of the application.
        Since:
        1

      • getIcon

        public String getIcon​()
        Obtains the path where the icon resource file of the application is saved.

        The icon tag specifies the path where the icon resource file of an application is stored. You can configure this tag in the configuration file. The default value is an empty string, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the path storing the icon resource file of the application; returns an empty string if the icon tag is not specified.
        Since:
        1

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel​()
        Obtains the name of the application visible to users or the resource index of the application name.

        The label tag specifies the application name displayed to users. You can configure this tag in the configuration file. The default value is an empty string, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the application name or the resource index of the application name; returns an empty string if the label tag is not specified.
        Since:
        1

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription​()
        Obtains the description of the application or the resource index of the application description.

        The description tag provides the application description. You can configure this tag in the configuration file. The default value is an empty string, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the application description or the resource index of the application description; returns an empty string if the description tag is not specified.
        Since:
        1

      • getProcess

        public String getProcess​()
        Obtains the name of the process in which this application should run.
        Returns:
        Returns the process name if it is set; returns the bundle name of this application otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getSupportedModes

        public int getSupportedModes​()
        Checks whether the application supports the driving mode.

        By default, the driving mode is not supported.

        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the application does not support the driving mode; returns 1 otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getModuleSourceDirs

        public List<String> getModuleSourceDirs​()
        Obtains the path storing the module resources of the application.
        Returns:
        Returns the path storing the module resources of the application.
        Since:
        1

      • getPermissions

        public List<String> getPermissions​()

        Since:

      • getModuleInfos

        public List<ModuleInfo> getModuleInfos​()
        Obtains information about all modules of the application.
        Returns:

        Since:
        1

      • getSystemApp

        public boolean getSystemApp​()
        Checks whether the application is a system application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if it is a system application; returns false otherwise.

      • dump

        public void dump​(String prefix,
                 PrintWriter writer)
          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Prints the process information of the application into a specified target.
        Parameters:
        prefix - Indicates the prefix of the attribute names contained in the printed information.
        writer - Indicates the target into which the information will be printed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is illegal.
